打你的脸？可以。However, let’s do an apples and apples comparison, he said in pointing out that many countries including the United Kingdom and Australia which are often used as comparison due to the similarity of post-Colonial era civil service structure put in place by the British Empire.He highlighted that while our country has 1.4 million civil servants to a population of 30 million, the UK has 450,000 in government service serving a population of 64 million, which at a glance looks like over-staffing in Malaysia's case but there are glaring disparities.The UK’s National Health Service alone employs nearly 1.3 million people, quite close to our total number of civil servants of 1.4 million.CEO of of Pemandu, the Performance Management and Delivery Unit, Datuk Seri Idris JalaThe UK does not count all these staff as part of their civil service whereas Malaysia includes all doctors, nurses and support staff in our public health system as part of civil service manpower numbers.Malaysia also includes all teachers in our public schools in our civil service figures but the UK does not.
